snippet: President Hugo Chávez left behind a nation in the grip of political turmoil that grew more acute as he languished for weeks.
abstract: Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez dies at age 58 after struggle with cancer, leaving behind bitterly divided nation in grip of a political crisis that grew more acute as he languished for weeks; crowds mass in capital of Caracas, mourning populist who defied the United States; his death is sure to bring vast uncertainty as nation tries to find its way without its central figure.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by María Eugenia Díaz, Girish Gupta and Meridith Kohut from Caracas; María Iguarán from Cumaná, Venezuela; and David E. Sanger and Thom Shanker from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Hugo Chávez left behind a nation in the grip of political turmoil that grew more acute as he languished for weeks.

headline.main: Chávez Dies, Leaving Sharp Divisions in Venezuela
headline.print_headline: Chávez Dies at 58 with Venezuela in Deep Turmoil
headline.sub: Leftist’s Demise at 58 Deepens Crisis in a Divided Country
